Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Hmm this is a detailed and wellstructured process description but as an analyst I know there are always gaps between the ideal process and how it actually works The interviewee gave a clear linear overview but realworld processes have dependencies exceptions and human judgment calls that need unpacking

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: I should focus on asking questions that reveal the hidden complexities The goal is to understand not just the what but the why and the how behind each step Ill organize my questions around key themes process boundaries decision logic communication flows exception handling and success metrics

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For process boundaries I need to know what triggers this whole workflow and what officially ends it The handoff points between roles are particularly important to map Decision criteria need to be concrete depends on workload is vague so Ill ask for specific thresholds or scoring systems Communication patterns matter because they reveal coordination pain points Exception handling is where processes often break down so I need examples of common deviations Finally understanding how they measure success will show what they truly value in this process

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The questions should be openended to encourage detailed explanations not yesno answers Ill avoid technical implementation details and stay at the conceptual level as requested
